item.title: Destructuring as a refactor in Clojure
item.description: Manuel has taught us today about the default value while destructuring: The following example illustrates the use of an :as directive to bind a local with the entire map. user=> (def point {:x 5 :y 7}) #'user/point (let [{:keys [x y] :as the-point} point] (println "x:" x "y:" y "point:" the-point)) x: 5 y: 7 point: {:x 5, :y 7} We’ve now seen the :as directive used for both vectors and maps.
